item.title: Hexabyte launches S3-compatible Object Storage based in the EU, Sweden
item.description:
Hexabyte has launched a new S3-compatible object storage service based in the EU, Sweden. The service is designed to integrate with standard S3-compatible tools and APIs and can be used across a variety of workloads. The price is €5 / TB / month with free ingress, egress and API calls. Typical use cases include:
Server, database, and file backups Application storage requiring an S3-compatible API Media and file archives for images, video, and documents Cloud storage... (continued)

item.title: RAKsmart APAC Anti-DDoS Adds 200Gbps Protection, Console Gets a Major Upgrade
item.description:
RAKsmart’s latest upgrade tackles both high-concurrency attacks and inefficient management. The APAC DDoS lineup—VPS, Bare-Metal Cloud, and Dedicated Servers—now supports up to 200Gbps elastic protection on mainland China–optimized routes, helping you stay online through spikes and attacks. The console was redesigned for faster operations:
Message Notifications: Real-time delivery of promotion updates, support ticket notifications, product alerts, and incident/outage messages. User Center (Right Sidebar): Access to Account Management and the Security Center. Left Sidebar (4 Main Sections): 1.... (continued)

item.title: Hosta Blanca VPS in Spain and Germany
item.description: Hosta Blanca, a young provider from Spain, is reviewed for the first time at VPSBenchmarks. Host Blanca offers VPS, Dedicated servers and domain registration. It has locations in Spain and Germany. VPS monthly prices start at 3.99€ for 2 vCPUs and 2GB RAM.

item.title: Native EUR and USD payments at HostUp
item.description: HostUp, a Swedish VPS and Web Hosting provider introduces native euro and dollar payments in addition to Swedish Krona. You can now buy your servers using the currency of your home country if it's in the Euro zone or in the USA. This will guarantee stable charges over time regardless of currency markets fluctuations.

item.title: Performance-Focused VPS Hosting with Transparent Pricing and Human Support
item.description: RackNerd is a US-based infrastructure provider offering VPS, dedicated servers, and web hosting services across multiple global data center locations. VPS Platforms: Intel Xeon and AMD Ryzen RackNerd operates two distinct KVM VPS product lines, allowing customers to choose the platform that best fits their workload requirements: Standard KVM VPS (Intel Xeon) Powered by Intel Xeon processors and backed by enterprise SSD storage in RAID-10, this lineup focuses on reliability, balanced performance, and predictable I/O behavior. It is well... (continued)

item.title: Best VPS 2025 just updated
item.description: The Best VPS 2025 rankings in 6 prices ranges were just updated. The new revisions cover the 12 months of trials up to November 31st 2025. Check them out at Best VPS 2025.

item.title: Contabo free 1-click Apps for n8n, Nextcloud, GitLab & WireGuard available on all VPS and VDS plans
item.description:
Contabo expanded its lineup of free 1-click applications, making self-hosting significantly faster and more accessible. Users can now deploy n8n, Nextcloud, WireGuard, and GitLab on any VPS or VDS in just a single click, without manual configuration or additional fees. These additions simplify the setup of development tools, automation systems, private clouds, and secure networks - allowing users to get production-ready environments running within minutes. 1-Click Apps Available Now
n8n: Powerful Workflow Automation n8n makes it easy to automate... (continued)

item.title: 0ping.eu Launches New High-RAM VPS Line with Octa-Channel Performance
item.description: 0ping.eu has announced the launch of its new High RAM VPS lineup, engineered for users who require extremely large memory capacity and uncompromising performance. Plans start at 16 GB RAM and extend up to 128 GB, all powered by octa-channel memory, delivering over 200 GB/s of memory bandwidth. The lineup is built on AMD Threadripper Pro CPUs, which offer an excellent balance between high single-core performance and massive RAM capacity/bandwidth, making them ideal for both compute-heavy and memory-intensive workloads. All... (continued)

item.title: TakeHost.Biz Deploys New VPS Nodes Featuring AMD EPYC 7763
item.description:
TakeHost.Biz today announced a significant upgrade to its Virtual Private Server (VPS) infrastructure with the deployment of new high-performance nodes powered by AMD EPYC 7763 processors. This hardware refresh aims to provide customers with substantial improvements in compute efficiency, network throughput, and workload stability. The new VPS offering utilizes the AMD EPYC 7763 (Milan) CPU architecture, delivering enhanced performance consistency and superior resource utilization for demanding applications, data processing, and development environments. Key specifications and performance details include:
Processor:... (continued)

item.title: VPSBenchmarks publishes 2025 Best Enterprise VPS Ranking
item.description: VPSBenchmarks has just released the new Best Enterprise VPS 2025 ranking, designed for professionals and businesses looking for top-tier cloud performance and reliability. This benchmark series highlights premium cloud providers that combine advanced infrastructure, hourly billing, and a wide ecosystem of services — from object storage and private networking to scalable compute instances. As in previous editions, the ranking focuses on technical excellence and service quality rather than entry-level pricing. There are two notable changes in this last revision: *... (continued)

item.title: Leaseweb Public Cloud & VPS: Now Available in Australia
item.description:
Leaseweb has expanded its cloud portfolio in Australia with the launch of Public Cloud and VPS services from its Sydney data center. Previously focused on dedicated servers, colocation, and network services, Leaseweb’s Australian operations now support a broader range of virtualized infrastructure options for businesses seeking scalable, locally hosted solutions. Leaseweb Virtual Private Servers Leaseweb VPS provides a straightforward way for small businesses and development teams to deploy applications on reliable infrastructure with predictable costs. Available configurations:
**4–24... (continued)

item.title: OnetSolutions introduces new High Performance VPS line with AMD EPYC 9554
item.description:
OnetSolutions has released a new generation of High Performance VPS based on AMD EPYC 9554 processors, DDR5 ECC memory, and enterprise-grade NVMe storage. The new line replaces the previous High Performance series and provides improved compute efficiency and memory bandwidth. The servers use KVM virtualization and are designed for compute-intensive workloads. Available Configurations:
HP-4: 2 vCores | 4 GB DDR5 | 40 GB NVMe | €7.99 / month HP-8: 4 vCores | 8 GB DDR5 | 80 GB... (continued)

item.title: Contabo Launches Limited Edition Cloud VPS SP Plans
item.description:
Contabo has released a limited set of Cloud VPS SP Plans, designed for higher performance and resource efficiency while keeping price accessible. These plans are available for a short period and are not listed on the main VPS page.
Built on AMD EPYC processors, each plan provides more RAM and storage than Contabo’s standard VPS range at similar prices. NVMe storage and optimized host allocation, ensure fast disk I/O and low latency operation.
Available Configurations:
**Cloud VPS... (continued)

item.title: Melbicom deploys a new PoP in Tokyo, Japan
item.description: Melbicom, an EU-headquartered Infrastructure-as-a-Service provider, has launched a new Virtual Private Server (VPS) location in Tokyo, Japan. This location delivers lower latency, higher resilience, and local data residency options for users across the Asia-Pacific region. Low-Latency Infrastructure The Tokyo facility connects directly to Japan’s primary Internet Exchanges — BBIX, JPIX, and JPNA — enabling short, redundant routes between major Asian carriers and international networks. These connections reduce latency by an average of 71% compared to routes served from other APAC... (continued)

item.title: TakeHost first Ryzen 9 VPS trial in Germany
item.description: TakeHost.Biz just had its first VPS plan tested at VPSBenchmarks: DE 8GB RAM. All TakeHost.Biz plans run on AMD Ryzen 9 9950X and those plans currently go for 10€ for 4 cores and 8GB RAM (regular price 20€). Backups are included by default. TakeHost.Biz data center is in Germany and it is headquartered in Norway.

item.title: Next-Gen VPS Hosting at 0ping.eu
item.description: 0ping.eu is a European VPS provider that focuses on low-latency connectivity and modern infrastructure. The company aims to combine the latest-generation hardware with a strong, well-peered network to provide a balanced platform for a wide range of applications. Based in Frankfurt, one of Europe’s best-connected hubs, 0ping.eu benefits from direct peering with many networks, which helps reduce round-trip times. Regular hardware refresh cycles are part of its operations, ensuring customers always run on up-to-date systems without unexpected service changes. 0ping.eu... (continued)

item.title: New VPS 2026
item.description: OVHcloud US has just released its second‑generation Virtual Private Servers, VPS 2026, and has made it available on its Local Zone edge‑computing network. VPS 2026 builds on KVM virtualization to provide isolated compute, RAM and NVMe storage resources with full root access. You can select from six configurations ranging from 4 vCores/8 GB RAM/75 GB disk to 24 vCores/96 GB RAM/400 GB NVMe. All plans include unlimited traffic with guaranteed bandwidth (from 400 Mbps to 3 Gbps) and daily backups. OVHcloud offers a choice of Linux, Windows and FreeBSD distributions and supports popular control panels like... (continued)

item.title: Netcup releases new EPYC 9645 based VPS line
item.description: The Root Server G12 run on AMD EPYC™ 9645 with 2GB RAM and 64GB storage per core. The price per core is around 3€. If you're a new customer, you can get 2 months free with promo codes on the VPS Coupons page

item.title: Cherry Servers launches new line of ARM based cloud servers
item.description: Cherry Servers released a new line of VDS based on dedicated AmpereONE A192-32X hardware ARM cores. The pricing is around 8€ per core and amount of RAM with each plan is very generous (6GB per core or more). The new VDS are available in Lithuania. Cloud ARM VDS.

item.title: New line of OVHcloud VPS
item.description: OVHcloud unveils a new line of VPS starting at 4.49€/mo with 4 cores and 8GB RAM. All VPS come with unlimited bandwidth and free standard daily backups. The new VPS line replaces both the old Intel VPS and AMD VLE lines of servers. Prices are listed at https://www.ovhcloud.com/en-ie/vps/.
